verses.verse: And God<WH430> remembered<WH2142> Noah<WH5146>, and every living thing<WH2416>, and all the cattle<WH929> that was with him in the ark<WH8392>: and God<WH430> made<WH5674> a wind<WH7307> to pass<WH5674> over<WH5921> the earth<WH776>, and the waters<WH4325> asswaged<WH7918>;
The fountains<WH4599> also of the deep<WH8415> and the windows<WH699> of heaven<WH8064> were stopped<WH5534>, and the rain<WH1653> from heaven<WH8064> was restrained<WH3607>;

And the waters<WH4325> returned<WH7725> from off the earth<WH776> continually<WH1980> <WH7725>: and after the end<WH7097> of the hundred<WH3967> and fifty<WH2572> days<WH3117> the waters<WH4325> were abated<WH2637>. continually: Heb. in going and returning
And the ark<WH8392> rested<WH5117> in the seventh<WH7637> month<WH2320>, on the seventeenth<WH6240> <WH7651> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320>, upon the mountains<WH2022> of Ararat<WH780>.

And the waters<WH4325> decreased<WH2637> continually<WH1980> until<WH5704> the tenth<WH6224> month<WH2320>: in the tenth<WH6224> month, on the first<WH259> day of the month<WH2320>, were the tops<WH7218> of the mountains<WH2022> seen<WH7200>. decreased: Heb. were in going and decreasing
And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of forty<WH705> days<WH3117>, that Noah<WH5146> opened<WH6605> the window<WH2474> of the ark<WH8392> which he had made<WH6213>:

And he sent forth<WH7971> a raven<WH6158>, which went forth<WH3318> to<WH3318> and fro<WH7725>, until the waters<WH4325> were dried up<WH3001> from off the earth<WH776>. to: Heb. in going forth and returning
Also he sent forth<WH7971> a dove<WH3123> from him, to see<WH7200> if the waters<WH4325> were abated<WH7043> from off the face<WH6440> of the ground<WH127>;

But the dove<WH3123> found<WH4672> no rest<WH4494> for the sole<WH3709> of her foot<WH7272>, and she returned<WH7725> unto him into the ark<WH8392>, for the waters<WH4325> were on the face<WH6440> of the whole earth<WH776>: then he put forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027>, and took her<WH3947>, and pulled her in<WH935> unto him into the ark<WH8392>. pulled: Heb. caused her to come
And he stayed<WH2342> yet other<WH312> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>; and again<WH3254> he sent forth<WH7971> the dove<WH3123> out of the ark<WH8392>;

And the dove<WH3123> came in<WH935> to him in the evening<WH6256> <WH6153>; and, lo, in her mouth<WH6310> was an olive<WH2132> leaf<WH5929> pluckt off<WH2965>: so Noah<WH5146> knew<WH3045> that the waters<WH4325> were abated<WH7043> from off the earth<WH776>.
And he stayed<WH3176> yet other<WH312> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>; and sent forth<WH7971> the dove<WH3123>; which returned<WH7725> not again<WH3254> unto him any more<WH5750>.

And it came to pass in the six<WH8337> hundredth<WH3967> and first year<WH8141>, in the first<WH7223> month, the first<WH259> day of the month<WH2320>, the waters<WH4325> were dried up<WH2717> from off the earth<WH776>: and Noah<WH5146> removed<WH5493> the covering<WH4372> of the ark<WH8392>, and looked<WH7200>, and, behold, the face<WH6440> of the ground<WH127> was dry<WH2717>.
And in the second<WH8145> month<WH2320>, on the seven<WH7651> and twentieth<WH6242> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320>, was the earth<WH776> dried<WH3001>.
And God<WH430> spake<WH1696> unto Noah<WH5146>, saying<WH559>,
Go forth<WH3318> of the ark<WH8392>, thou, and thy wife<WH802>, and thy sons<WH1121>, and thy sons'<WH1121> wives<WH802> with thee.

Bring forth<WH3318> with thee every living thing<WH2416> that is with thee, of all flesh<WH1320>, both of fowl<WH5775>, and of cattle<WH929>, and of every creeping thing<WH7431> that creepeth<WH7430> upon the earth<WH776>; that they may breed abundantly<WH8317> in the earth<WH776>, and be fruitful<WH6509>, and multiply<WH7235> upon the earth<WH776>.
And Noah<WH5146> went forth<WH3318>, and his sons<WH1121>, and his wife<WH802>, and his sons'<WH1121> wives<WH802> with him:

Every beast<WH2416>, every creeping thing<WH7431>, and every fowl<WH5775>, and whatsoever<WH3605> creepeth<WH7430> upon the earth<WH776>, after their kinds<WH4940>, went forth<WH3318> out of the ark<WH8392>. kinds: Heb. families

And Noah<WH5146> builded<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> unto the LORD<WH3068>; and took<WH3947> of every clean<WH2889> beast<WH929>, and of every clean<WH2889> fowl<WH5775>, and offered<WH5927> burnt offerings<WH5930> on the altar<WH4196>.

And the LORD<WH3068> smelled<WH7306> a sweet<WH5207> savour<WH7381>; and the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> in<WH413> his heart<WH3820>, I will not again<WH3254> curse<WH7043> the ground<WH127> any more for man's<WH120> sake<WH5668>; for the imagination<WH3336> of man's<WH120> heart<WH3820> is evil<WH7451> from his youth<WH5271>; neither will I again<WH3254> smite<WH5221> any more every thing living<WH2416>, as I have done<WH6213>. a sweet: Heb. a savour of rest or, satisfaction for the imagination: or, through the imagination

While the earth<WH776> remaineth<WH3117>, seedtime<WH2233> and harvest<WH7105>, and cold<WH7120> and heat<WH2527>, and summer<WH7019> and winter<WH2779>, and day<WH3117> and night<WH3915> shall not cease<WH7673>. While: Heb. As yet all the days of the earth
